intro: Crassula setulosa var. setulosa, commonly known as the woolly crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features dense, fuzzy leaves that are typically green or bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for arid environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
